events.name: Tech Talk Tuesday with Prof Masahiko Inami
events.description: Join us for our upcoming Tech Talk! Our guest speaker, Mr Masahiko INAMI will be sharing with us his Japanese anime-inspired 'invisibility cloak! http://www.gov-online.go.jp/eng/publicity/book/hlj/html/201201/201201_03.html Biography: Masahiko INAMI is an professor at KEIO Media Design. He is also directing JST ERATO Igarashi Design Interface Project as a group leader. He received Ph.D. from department of engineering, the University of Tokyo in March, 1999. His research interest is in Interactive Technique, Physical Media, Robotics and Entertainment Technology. He is known as the inventor of Optical Camouflage system. He received Laval Virtual Technopole Mayenne Trophee, TIME Magazine Coolest Inventions2003, IEEE Virtual Reality 2004 Best Paper Award, ICAT 2004 Best Paper Award and more.
events.location: The Prototyping Lab @ NDC 111 MIddle Road S188969

events.name: The Hard Parts About Publishing Your Own Book, And How To Overcome Them by @Zell Liew
events.description: Have you thought about writing your own book, but quickly gave up on the idea? Zell thought about it for more than 7 months. When he started, he only had 67 people on his email list. He then went on to sell over 100 copies of his book, earn over $8,000 and gain 1,000 email subscribers in 3 months. Find out how he overcame his barriers to self publishing and how you can do the same Speaker profile: Zell is a freelance website designer and developer. He also authored Learning Susy, a book created to help developers pick up the Susy Tool for developing websites. He started to learn to code only in his final year in university and has been freelancing ever since he stepped out of school.

events.name: Sunday Showcase
events.description: Sunday Showcase allows visitors unique access to cutting edge projects being undertaken by different tertiary institutions across Singapore. The series invites the creators and their work into ArtScience Museum on a Sunday each month. The creators are on hand throughout the afternoon to talk with visitors about their inventions, their creative process, and to facilitate visitors' interaction with the projects. There is something for everyone in this hands-on, accessible showcase series. Input, Process, Output Sunday 11 January, 1pm – 7pm FREE The MediaLab at LASALLE College of the Arts presents an engaging and varied body of student works, including new musical instruments, design prototypes, and image-making machines.

events.name: Creative Crew Talks - January Meeting 2015
events.description: Using Adobe Illustrator efficiently as a Designer By Mark Plunkett When it comes to designing layouts and creation of logo, you will most likely be using Adobe Illustrator as your number one software. It doesn’t really matter if you are a beginner or an advanced user of Adobe Illustrator, the hottest topic would be about why Adobe Illustrator takes so long to load and save a file. In this session, Mark Plunkett - Director and Designer of Dexel, a graphic design agency will share about some of his most used tips and features during projects at his workplace. ===================== Creative design tools for Mobile App Developers By Arul Kumaran Hear from Arul Kumaran, CTO and Multiplatform Developer at Luracast Singapore to share his experience on the design and development of mobile applications. Developers will also need to know design tools well in order to better market their apps. In this session, you will explore some of the techniques using image editing tool, Adobe Photoshop and screen design tool, Adobe Fireworks on developing mobile apps. He will also share some of the plugins that can make them even more powerful and helpful for the given tasks. ===================== Allow your designs to shine By Linus Lim One of the design principles is to create order and hierarchy in your designs resulting in beautiful and easy to read layouts. In this session you will learn the tips to apply alignments into your designs to give them a professional edge. Icons are used everywhere in user interfaces for websites and mobile apps. The design principle for designing icons is to keep them simple, modern and friendly. Linus will also share how he draws icons for your screen design.

events.name: InDesign Hacks and Variable Data
events.description: ======================== Registration Details (at Xerox Building) ========================= Registration starts from 5.45pm, please proceed immediately to level 4, Fuji Xerox Tower at Anson Road. This session will start at 6.00pm. ========================= Speakers Bio ========================= Mark Plunkett Design Director of Dexel and Generic Print Shirley Tan Training Director of ACE Training ========================= Meeting Topics ========================= Round 1 8 Hacks that can Solve your InDesign Problems Want to learn some quick and easy InDesign hacks that are easy to do, low cost and saves you time? You're in luck. I have compiled my favourite 8 to get you going. They helped me solved many problems related to text, tables, colours and many more. Ready? Round 2 Learn the basics of Variable Data with InDesign InDesign is not just about creating layouts or publications or micro sites, it is also widely used for variable data or customised 'named' designs. Come down to learn more about what is variable data and how you can use it in your workplace efficiently. ========================= Agenda ========================= 6.00pm - 6.30pm Round 1 with Shirley Tan 6.30pm - 6.40pm Short break & Refreshments 6.40pm - 7.10pm Round 2 with Mark Plunkett 7.10pm - 7.30pm FAQ session ========================= Refreshments ========================= Hot beverages, water and snacks will be provided during the meeting with compliments from Fuji Xerox Singapore. ========================= Facebook ========================= http://www.facebook.com/groups/idugsg/ ========================= Twitter ========================= @InDesignSG ========================= Sponsors ========================= This meeting has been made possible with the generous support of Adobe and Fuji Xerox Singapore.

events.description: PyData Meetup 1 Starting 2015 with some Python! Main talks 10-20 mins each ---- Speakers: - Thia Kai Xin: Optimization models - Eugene Teo: Spyre - Martin Andrews: Theano (& GPUs) - Asankhaya Sharma: Software security analytics - Shubham Goyal/Girish Kumar: Lightning Talks --- Showcase your python data hacks, visuals, findings Ask questions, learn and have fun! events.name: 5th ASEAN "Bridges" Event Series - Professor Brian P Schmidt, 2011 Nobel Laureate for Physics
events.description:
Keynote speaker: 
Professor Brian P Schmidt is a 2011 Nobel Laureate for Physics at the Australian National University. In 1994, Professor Schmidt and Professor Nicholas Suntzeff formed the HighZ SN search team, a group of 20 astronomers on five continents who used distant exploding stars to trace the expansion of the Universe back in time. The group’s discovery of an accelerating Universe was a startling one suggesting that an unknown force is countering the effect of gravity and pushing the Universe apart.  
Professor Schmidt continues his work using exploding stars to study the Universe, and is leading Australian National University’s Research School of Astronomy and Astrophysics’ effort to build the SkyMapper telescope. 
As part of the International Peace Foundation’s “Bridges – Dialogues Towards a Culture of Peace” speaker series at NUS, Professor Schmidt will also undertake engagements with Yale-NUS College. 
  

  
“Science: Humanity’s Universal Bridge”  
Science is one of the few arenas where humanity has worked together through history for our collective good. In his speech, Professor Schmidt will discuss the role of science through the ages in shaping our current society, reflecting on the good and the bad its knowledge has brought. While science's impact in our daily lives is higher now than ever before, to cope with future challenges the world will need further improve how it works together. It is through continual advances in our knowledge that we can hope to have the billions of the world's inhabitants live in peace and prosperity into the future.
events.location: Shaw Foundation Alumni House Auditorium, Level 2, 11 Kent Ridge Drive, Singapore 119244

events.name: "Future Cities: Prospects and Projections"@Urban Lab
events.description:
Join us for the launch of Urban Lab, a new dedicated exhibition space by URA that profiles the most innovative solutions for a sustainable and liveable urban environment. Urban Lab will open with its inaugural exhibition, ‘Future Cities: Prospects and Projections’ by FCL. This is a showcase of trans-disciplinary research on cities, urbanisation, and global environmental sustainability for the creation of a sustainable urban future. Come and find out how science, design and technology are shaping the landscape of our cities.  
  
FAQs 
  
What are my transport/parking options getting to the event? 
By public transport, the nearest MRT station is Tanjong Pagar MRT Station. Please use Exit A and walk along Peck Seah Street.  
By car, you may park at the URA East Wing car park. Please use the lift to access the link bridge on the second floor. Follow the signs for Singapore City Gallery, and take the escalator to the first floor.    
  
Is my invitation transferrable? 
Yes, in the event that you are unable to attend you may nominate someone to take your place. Please kindly inform the organisers. 
  
Do I have to bring my printed invitation to the event? 
No, you do not need to bring your invitation to the event.
events.location: Urban Redevelopment Authority, The URA Centre Atrium, 45 Maxwell Road, Singapore 069118
events.group_name: Urban Redevelopment Authority and Singapore-ETH Centre

events.name: Save Valuable Design Time by Creating Intelligent and Integrated 2D Electrical Schematics
events.description:
Simplify 2D electrical schematic creation by using an intuitive interface which provides faster results. Gain a competitive edge over others when you have more time to design innovative products and get them to market faster. 
  
With intelligent and integrated 2D electrical schematics, join us to find out how you can:  
  
1. Generate Innovative Designs Faster 

Reuse of existing design data

Enable multiple users to work on a project when required


Automation tools to streamline complex electrical design tasks


  
2. Reduce Manufacturing Defects  


Coordinated BOM


Ensure electrical items will fit before production


Plan entire product early before production


  
3. Reduce Overall Costs 


Reduce redesign costs by coordinating mechanical and electrical groups


Ensure MCAD and ECAD design changes are synchronized 


  
  
EVENT TITLE 
Save Valuable Time by Creating Intelligent and Integrated 2D Electrical Schematics

Electrical Engineers, Middle Management and other Engineers who want to learn about SolidWorks Electrical and how ATE will value add in meeting engineering challenges.

events.name: ArtScience Late
events.description: One Thursday a month, 7pm to 10pm Expression Gallery, Level 4 The full line-up of ArtScience Late until January 2015 can be viewed here:http://bit.ly/artsciencelate For one evening a month, ArtScience Museum transforms into a night-time platform for artists in the fields of performance and new media to experiment, explore, discover and challenge their artistic boundaries. Come to a space where interaction, collaboration and experimentation are de rigueur of the night, and chill out with music and our bar overlooking Marina Bay. Hypermnesia 8pm & 9pm featuring Composit formed by Shunsuke Francois Nanjo (Japan/France), Kensuke Christophe Nanjo (Japan/France) and Nicolas Charbonnier (France) in collaboration with Eisa Jocson (The Philippines) The installation Hypermnesia is the result of artists and mechanical engineers working together. The team have developed for this unique occasion an interactive pole installation for the internationally celebrated choreographer/performer Eisa Jocson. The artwork will react to her body heat and movement, and the audience is also invited to interact with the artwork through touch, altering the sound in the background. Entry is complimentary and on a first come first served basis.

events.name: Reduce Manufacturing Defects and Scrap with Schematic Creation to Your 3D Electrical Designs
events.description:
Take your electrical schematics to the next dimension SolidWorks Electrical 3D enables you to use your schematic data from SolidWorks Electrical with your overall mechanical design, opening up a new level of productivity. Concurrent design between electrical and mechanical teams can now be a reality—in real time. You can collaborate easily and naturally, optimize the overall product design, and streamline development.  
  
Key capabilities include: 

Real-time bi-directional updates between 2D and 3D synchronize electromechanical design so everything stays coordinated throughout development
Integration of the 2D schematic with the 3D model helps standardize designs and unify your BOMs to reduce mistakes and delays
Placement of the electrical system and cables/wires in your 3D model enables planning of specific locations and paths for consistent product manufacturing

 



  
EVENT TITLE 
Reduce Manufacturing Defects and Scrap with Schematic Creation to Your 3D Electrical Designs 
  
WHO SHOULD ATTEND 
Electrical Engineers, Middle Management and other Engineers who want to learn about SolidWorks Electrical (2D & 3D Integration) and how ATE will value add in meeting engineering challenges. 
   
AGENDA 
02:00pm: Critical Pain Points of Electrical Engineers During the Four Stages of Design 
02:30pm: 2D to 3D Electrical Integrated Workflow 
03:30pm: Hands-On Walkthrough
